accordion.title: Why should I become a locksmith?
accordion.content:
Unlike many other freelance professions, locksmithing provides exceptional value for your time. For example, replacing a cylinder typically takes around 15 minutes and can earn you a minimum of $150. Similarly, installing a door, even for a beginner locksmith, averages 6 minutes and brings in approximately $180, with no additional investment required.

This profession offers flexibility and is well-suited for a variety of individuals. Whether you are a recent military veteran, currently employed and seeking supplementary income, or planning to start your own business, locksmithing allows you to set your own hours. Naturally, the more available you are, the greater your earning potential becomes.

It’s no surprise that locksmithing is one of the most in-demand careers in the U.S. job market. With dedication and effort, you can quickly see significant growth in your income.

accordion.title: How much does a locksmith earn?
accordion.content:
There is a high demand for locksmith services, with thousands of potential calls each day. By responding to just two calls per day, you can earn an average of $350 daily. Simple calculations show that working 25 days per month can yield a minimum income of $8,750. Over time, this can grow to as much as $12,000 per month, depending on your dedication and effective advertising.

Your income is directly related to the effort you put in and your marketing strategy, and we will provide you with all the necessary resources to succeed. The key to success is persistence and making yourself available.

accordion.title: Will I receive a certificate at the end of the course?
accordion.content: Upon completing the course and successfully passing our online assessments, you will earn a locksmithing certificate, recognizing the knowledge and skills you have gained.

accordion.title: Is there a demand for locksmiths?
accordion.content: Indeed! In the United States, there are over 70 million locksmith service requests annually, with a significant shortage of locksmiths to meet the demand. This highlights a genuine need for more individuals to enter the locksmithing profession, providing essential services to private, public, and institutional clients nationwide.

accordion.title: I have a full time job, can I increase my income by pursuing locksmithing as a side profession?
accordion.content: Yes, it is possible. The average salary in the U.S. often falls short of covering the rising cost of living. If you’re working until 5 PM and looking to increase your income, you can advertise your services online or work as a contractor on a commission basis. By dedicating some time after your regular job, you could potentially add an additional $7,000 to your monthly earnings.
